raw_text:
Gritty return for Prince of Persia
 
 Still basking in the relatively recent glory of last year's Sands Of Time, the dashing Prince of Persia is back in Warrior Within, and in a more bellicose mood than last time.
 
 This sequel gives the franchise a grim, gritty new look and ramps up the action and violence. As before, you control the super-athletic prince from a third-person perspective. The time-travelling plot hinges on the Dahaka, an all-consuming monster pursuing our hero through the ages. The only way to dispel it is to turn back the clock again and kill the sultry Empress Of Time before she ever creates the Sands of Time that caused the great beast's creation.
 
 Studiously structured though this back story is, everything boils down to old-fashioned fantasy gameplay which proves, on the whole, as dependable as it needs to be. Ever since the series' then-groundbreaking beginnings on the Commodore Amiga, Prince of Persia has always been about meticulously-animated acrobatic moves, that provide an energetic blend of leaping preposterously between pieces of scenery and lopping off enemies' body parts.
 
 Those flashy moves are back in full evidence, and tremendous fun to perform and perfect. Combining them at speed is the best fun, although getting a handle of doing so takes practice and plenty of skill. Until you reach that point, it is a haphazard business. All too often, you will perform a stunning triple somersault, pirouette off a wall, knock out three enemies in one glorious swoop, before plummeting purposefully over a cliff to your doom. That in turn can mean getting set back an annoyingly long distance, for you can only save at the fountains dotted along the path. The expected fiendish puzzles are all present and correct, but combat is what is really been stepped up, and there is more of it than before. The game's developers have combined acrobatic flair with gruesome slaying techniques in some wonderfully imaginative ways. Slicing foes down the middle is one particularly entertaining method of seeing them off.
 
 Warrior Within is a very slick package; the game's intro movie is so phenomenally good that it actually does an ultimate disservice once the game itself commences.
 
 It is on a par with the jaw-dropping opening sequence of Onimusha 3 earlier this year, and when the game begins, it is something of an anti-climax. That said, the graphics are excellent, and indeed among the most striking and satisfying elements of the game. The music is probably the worst aspect - a merit-free heavy metal soundtrack that you will swiftly want to turn off. There is something strangely unsatisfying about the game. Perhaps precisely because its graphics and mechanics are so good that the story and overall experience are not quite as engaging as they should be. Somehow it adds up to less than the sum of its parts, and is more technically impressive than it is outright enjoyable. But that is not to say Warrior Within is anything other than a superb adventure that most will thoroughly enjoy. It just does not quite take the character to the new heights that might have been hoped for.
llama3.2:1b: Gritty return for Prince of Persia, with a more bellicose tone and increased action and violence. The game's time-traveling plot hinges on killing the Empress Of Time before creating the Sands of Time. Gameplay features old-fashioned fantasy gameplay, including acrobatic moves and combat. The game includes expected fiendish puzzles, but combat is where the real fun lies. Graphics and music are excellent, with an impressive intro movie that sets a high standard for the rest of the game.
llama3.2:3b: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within returns with a gritty look and increased action and violence, maintaining the franchise's dependable fantasy gameplay. The game features improved graphics, but a heavy metal soundtrack and less engaging story bring down the overall experience.
gemma2:2b: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within features a grittier, more action-oriented setting and follows a time-travelling plot involving the Dahaka monster. The game maintains its classic acrobatic gameplay with stunning moves and challenging puzzles. Combat is enhanced with gruesome techniques like slicing foes in half. While visually impressive and mechanically satisfying, the narrative and overall experience are not as engaging as they could be. Despite this, Warrior Within remains a superb adventure that most players will enjoy.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within features a gritty, gritty return to last year's classic action-adventure game. The sequel improves upon previous strengths like acrobatic moves and thrilling battles by using high-quality graphics. It also brings back old-school battle choreography with a mix of leaping acrobatics and brutal combat techniques. While the story holds up well, the gameplay feels unfulfilling.
qwen2.5:1.5b: The Prince of Persia video game series, now featuring gritty visuals and intense action, returns with Warrior Within, maintaining its signature acrobatic gameplay while adding more violent combat. The story follows Prince Soth as he fights against Dahaka, a time-travelling monster seeking to alter history. Players control the prince through animated jumps and sword battles in a third-person perspective. Despite an over-the-top intro, the game's graphics and music are excellent, but its narrative fails to match the visuals and mechanics' quality, resulting in a generally enjoyable but not outstanding experience.
qwen2.5:3b: Gritty return for Prince of Persia in Warrior Within, offering grim, gritty visuals and more intense action compared to Sands Of Time. Gameplay focuses on acrobatic moves and old-fashioned fantasy gameplay. The game provides a satisfying experience with flashy animations, but the story and overall experience are less engaging despite excellent graphics and music. It is technically impressive but not as enjoyable as expected.
opencoder:1.5b:
Gritty return for Prince of Persia remains an exciting saga about the unpredictable journey of time. While it's rife with fantasy gameplay, everything boils down to old-fashioned storytelling and acrobatic moves.
 
The game offers a unique blend of intense action and adventure, combining ancient fantasy with modern science fiction techniques. The dashing prince from Warrior Within is perfectly controlled by a third-person perspective, and the plot hinges on Dahaka - an all-consuming monster who is driven by time to consume our heroine, forcing her to turn back and kill him. 

The story unfolds as though the world has been made out of sand and time, creating an enigma that challenges one's perception of reality. The game’s mechanics are simple yet effective, allowing players to perform acrobatic moves, perfecting their skills as they go about their quest.

In the end, it is a thrilling chase, with each act adding to the story's depth and setting its sights on the final boss. The balance between difficulty and story tells a compelling tale of time and discovery.
smollm:1.7b:
Summarize the following text concisely, preserving key ideas and details:
The Prince of Persia returns in Warrior Within, and the game takes on a more serious tone than last time. The story is about the same old fantasy setting, but with some new twists and turns. The gameplay is still action-packed, but it's not quite as intense as it was before. There are some good moments to be had, but overall the game feels like it could have been better.

Prince of Persia's sequels, including Warrior Within, return to the prince's journey in a gritty tone. The game increases action and violence, features the Dahaka monster as an antagonist. A refined acrobatic gameplay uses leaping between scenery pieces for a dynamic experience. Enhanced combat mechanics with triple somersaults are highlighted, though practice is needed. graphics are improved, but the overall experience remains engaging, balancing technical excellence with enjoyable gameplay.
tinyllama:1.1b: The Prince of Persia franchise returns in Warrior Within with its latest installment, following the story of the super-athletic prince as he navigates through a grim, gritty new look and ramped up action and violence. The Daheka monster is at the heart of the plot, while the time-traveling plot hinges on the Dhaqa empire's creation of the Sands of Time that caused the great beast to exist. The Prince's sole objective is to kill the Sulthia Empress and release the Sands of Time so the world can move forward. Despite the impressive graphics, the story is not quite as engaging as it should be, and the music feels out-of-place. Overall, while a superb adventure, Warrior Within falls short of reaching its potential due to a lack of enjoyable aspects.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Prince of Persia, a popular and long-running video game series, returns in a gripping sequel named Warrior Within. This thrilling adventure takes players back to the ancient world through time and places like Mount Meru, where they will face the powerful Dahaka monster. With improved combat mechanics and a deeper storyline that emphasizes the importance of time travel, Warrior Within is sure to impress fans of the series.
phi:2.7b: Prince of Persia returns in Warrior Within with improved graphics, but the focus on acrobatic moves over storytelling leads to an overall less enjoyable experience. Despite this, it is still a highly entertaining adventure game that most players will enjoy.
orca-mini:3b: The sequel to Prince of Persia gives the franchise a more gritty and realistic look, while increasing the intensity and violence of the gameplay. The plot revolves around the Dahaka, an all-consuming monster pursuing the protagonist, and the only way to defeat it is to kill the sultry Empress of Time before she creates the Sands of Time that created the great beast's existence. The game emphasizes acrobatic moves, with intricate puzzles and gruesome combat techniques. The graphics and sound are excellent, but the story and overall experience lack substance, despite being technically impressive. However, the game is still an enjoyable adventure with stunning graphics and fluid gameplay.
hermes3:3b: Prince of Persia returns with a gritty sequel, _Warrior Within_, featuring increased action and violence over predecessor _Sands of Time_. Acrobatic gameplay retains from previous titles but stories are darker and more focused on combat against the time-traveling monster Dahaka.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Prince of Persia returns in Warrior Within, a gritty and action-packed sequel with a time-traveling plot involving the Dahaka monster. The game retains its dependable fantasy gameplay featuring acrobatic moves and combines them with new slaying techniques. Although combat is stepped up and the graphics are excellent, some aspects fall short, such as an anti-climactic intro movie, music that isn't engaging, and a story that doesn't quite reach new heights. Overall, Warrior Within remains a solid adventure that most will enjoy.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within is a darker, more action-packed sequel to Sands of Time, featuring a grittier aesthetic and intensified combat. The story revolves around the Prince being pursued by the monstrous Dahaka, forcing him to travel back in time to prevent the creation of the Sands of Time. The game retains the series' signature acrobatic gameplay, with fluid and exhilarating moves that require skill to master. Combat has been significantly expanded, incorporating brutal and imaginative slaying techniques. While the graphics are excellent and the mechanics polished, the heavy metal soundtrack is a weak point, and the overall experience feels slightly less engaging than expected. Despite this, Warrior Within remains a technically impressive and enjoyable adventure, though it falls short of elevating the series to new heights.
stablelm2:1.6b: Prince of Persia: Warrior Within returns with an increased action and violence, giving the franchise a grim, gritty look. As in the previous game, players control Prince of Persia from a third-person perspective and face off against enemies while performing acrobatic moves. The story revolves around an all-consuming monster and the characters involved in its creation. Combat is stepped up compared to the previous game, with imaginative ways to slice foes down the middle. Warrior Within has excellent graphics and music but struggles to engage players' story and overall experience. It's a superb adventure that most will enjoy; however, it doesn: 1523979406.
granite3.1-dense:2b:
Prince of Persia returns with "Warrior Within," featuring an enhanced, gritty, and action-oriented design compared to its predecessor, "Sands Of Time." The game maintains third-person control over the super-athletic prince and follows a time-traveling narrative centered around the Dahaka, a destructive force pursuing the Empress of Time. To defeat the Dahaka, the player must kill the Empress before she creates the Sands of Time that spawned it.

The gameplay emphasizes acrobatic moves and combat, which have been refined to include more diverse killing techniques. Players can execute impressive feats like triple somersaults and wall-pirouettes, but encountering cliffs often results in untimely deaths due to the limited save points.

"Warrior Within" boasts stunning graphics and an engaging intro movie, which might disappoint upon gameplay commencement. However, the music, a heavy metal soundtrack, is criticized for its lack of appeal. Despite its technical prowess, the story doesn't quite match the high expectations set by its impressive visuals and mechanics, making the overall experience feel less engaging than it could be. Nonetheless, it remains an exceptional adventure that most players will enjoy.
